Name: Beth Steinberg
Title: Chief People Person. Leadership Coach. Angel Investor.
About:
Beth Steinberg has over 20 years of experience in organization development, talent strategy, and leadership development. Her focus has been to help leaders and companies with complex organizational and growth issues. Beth focuses on driving useful employee programs, leadership coaching, executive development and organizational development for companies in both technology, and consumer goods and services companies. Beth has a proven track record of partnering with companies to help them scale for a successful outcome. Examples include:

Rypple -- Advisor, Acquired by Salesforce, December 2011
Facebook -- IPO, May 2012
BrightRoll -- Acquired by Yahoo!, December 2014
Sunrun -- IPO, August 2015
Hackbright Academy -- Advisor, Acquired by Capella Education, April 2016
WorkLife -- Advisor, Acquired by Cisco, October 2016
Jhana Education -- Advisor, Acquired by Franklin Covey Company, July 2017
Tenor -- Advisor, Acquired by Google, March 2018

Beth has her BA in Psychology from San Jose State University and took part in the Executive Program at Stanford University. Beth is certified in multiple MRG assessments and in the Hogan Assessment. She is also an International Coaching Federation Certified Leadership Coach. Beth is an advisor Felicis Ventures, Riverside Capital and Molekule.  Beth is very involved with the State Department's TechWomen Program. The program supports STEM careers and education in the Middle East, Central Asia, and Africa. Beth is a former board member of Social Venture Partners International (SVPI), Collective Roots and Hidden Villa.
Experience: Chime, Full-time · 2 yrs 9 mos, San Francisco Bay Area, Senior Vice President, People and Talent, Apr 2021 - Present · 1 yr 4 mos, Vice President, People & Talent, Nov 2019 - Apr 2021 · 1 yr 6 mos, Lead the People & Talent function for Chime. Chime is the largest and fastest-growing challenger banking company in the U.S., with over 5M accounts and no physical branches. We’re a technology company relentlessly focused on helping our members achieve financial peace of mind. Name: Janelle Sallenave
Title: Senior Vice President @ Chime | Board Member | UPenn, Stanford, Uber and Schwab Alum
About:
Janelle has 20+ years experience in leading multi-billion dollar businesses through growth accelerations, adjacent market entries, geographic expansions and transitions to profitability. She is a proven P&L owner and a seasoned operator with fast growing businesses. Janelle has built a reputation for innovative growth strategies, operational excellence, cost discipline, and a deep commitment to building diverse, high performing organizations in both established businesses and corporate acquisitions.

Currently, Janelle is a member of Chime's executive team and primarily responsible for operations and support functions. In this role, she drives the strategy, implementation and continuous improvement of the member experience for the 10M+ (and rapidly growing) accounts at Chime. Chime is the fastest growing fintech in the U.S.

In her prior role, Janelle led the Uber Eats business for the US and Canada. As the P&L owner for the largest business unit of Uber at the time, she had responsibility for strategy, operations, sales, marketing, support and other key functions.

Name: Jared Grusd
Title: Tech Executive
About:
Jared is passionate about the intersection of business, technology, and culture. He has played a critical role in shaping some of the world's most transformative companies. Currently, Jared is the chief strategy officer of Chime, one of the fastest-growing financial technology companies. Previously, Jared served as the chief strategy officer of Snapchat, the general counsel and global head of corporate development of Spotify, and a senior executive of Google. He also served in the dual capacity of chief executive officer of Huffpost and the global head of news and information at Verizon Media. Before that, he was the chief strategy and business development officer of AOL. 

In addition, Jared is an adjunct professor at Columbia Business School and an Advisory Council member and lecturer in law at the University of Chicago Law School. He is a co-founder and board member of an education technology company elevating written expression for all students. Jared co-founded Shake, a venture-backed legal technology company that LegalShield acquired. He served on the board of Newsela and SoulCycle. 

Jared has earned numerous industry accolades. On three separate occasions, Business Insider named him one of the hundred coolest and most influential people in the New York technology ecosystem. Adweek named him to its Class of Young Influentials who are "remaking business and culture." Fortune recognized him as one of the five most powerful technology lawyers. Jared received an MBA from Columbia Business School, a JD, with Honors, from the University of Chicago Law School, and a BA from the University of Pennsylvania.

Name: Oded Blatman
Title: CIO & CISO at Fireblocks
About:
Oded Blatman is an award-winning executive and systems consultant with over 20 years of experience in various positions in the IT and cyber domains, including CEO, CTO, CIO, CISO and IT Director in large enterprise companies, cloud s.a.a.s and small startups.

Oded has led successful M&A Security Due Diligence to meet the rigorous Trust and Security requirements of Salesforce enabling 1.4B$ acquisition of Clicksoftware!

In the security & IT field, Oded achieved a track record of providing unique solutions and developing original products for dynamic cyber and business needs. 
 
In his past role, Oded serves as the CIO & CISO of ClickSoftware,  the market and cloud technology leader in Field Service Management software, used by more than 350 global enterprises across 20+ industries.
Oded has extensive experience leading IT & Security programs across global business and IT environments, board-level reporting and cross-functional teams to successful acquisitions.
Oded is a visionary thinker, Seasoned professional with strong leadership and "can do" approach to accomplishing challenging tasks

Previously, Oded serves as the Chief Cyber Security Architect and CISO of Israel's largest Aerospace company, where he spearheaded an innovative cyber security architecture and implemented a new cyber defense center program, reducing cyber threats and operational costs significantly.
 
In the past, Oded worked as the IT Architect in one of Israel's major defense electronics companies, and specialized in implementing large international projects in homeland cyber security, cloud Infrastructure, and networking. Oded led onsite teams in Israel, Europe, and South East Asia, analyzing customers' strategic requirements, designing defense architecture, and integrating advanced technologies.

Oded is appreciated for his “can be done” attitude and recognized by his peers and managers as a sensitive communicator, motivational leader, and an easy going colleague. He excels in building high performing cross-functional teams, gaining corporate agreement, and leading complicated long term projects to successful completion.

Contact email: odedblatman@gmail.com

Name: Jessie Blocker
Title: Vice President of Sales, Strategic Accounts
About:
Jessie is currently Vice President of Sales, Strategic Accounts at Fireblocks, an institutional-grade service to secure digital asset transfers all from one platform. She has been working professionally in the cryptocurrency industry since early 2014.

Prior to joining the core team at Fireblocks, she built and managed strategic partnerships for lending and trading digital assets at Genesis Global Trading as Vice President of Corporate Partnerships. Before Genesis, she was the Manager of Customer Support at Xapo - one of the largest bitcoin wallet and vault services - and eventually became the Director of Institutional Accounts where she managed Xapo's institutional product, OTC desk and clients.

Name: Sebastian Siemiatkowski
Title: Co-founder and CEO at Klarna
About:
In 2005, two friends and I had an idea of making it easier for people to shop online. That idea became Klarna, which today is the most valued fintech company in Europe. With 85 million shoppers and 205 000 retailers in our family, Klarna is the biggest Buy Now Pay Later company in the world. And we are far from done.

We are growing like crazy, especially in the US where we saw a +230% growth in retailers in 2019. Some of the biggest e-commerce players have joined us on our journey, such as H&M, Ticketmaster, ASOS and Footlocker.

15 years later, I am still the CEO of Klarna, and I am still as passionate about the business. Through these years, Klarna has become so much more than just a payment provider. With us, you will get a true partnership. In my position, I am also lucky to get a lot of industry insights in chats with many other CEOs in the business.

For Klarna to stay on top in the constantly changing e-commerce industry, we put a lot of effort into keeping up to date with the latest trends and tech updates. This is possible thanks to our 3000+ employees who are challenging the status quo on a daily basis.

What are your business goals and what are you doing to achieve them?
Experience: Co-Founder / CEO, Klarna · Full-time, Feb 2005 - Present · 17 yrs 6 mos, Advisory Board Member, SSE Business Lab, May 2015 - Jun 2019 · 4 yrs 2 mos, Stockholm, Sweden
Education: Stockholm School of Economics, Bachelor's degree, Economics, 2000 - 2007, Activities and societies: East Asia Association, Activities and societies: East Asia Association

Title: Chief People Officer at Stripe
About: I am a global human resources leader, Board Member and Chief People Officer who brings 20+ years of strategic HR leadership, consulting and executive experience in fast-growing global software and financial technology organizations including Stripe, Autodesk, Deloitte and Glassdoor. As a consultant with multiple Fortune 500 and 100 companies, I’ve seen first-hand what makes those companies successful. I’m known for my ability to analyze and recognize patterns to determine where solutions and strategies have and have not worked. I advise executive teams and boards on a broad range of organizational and leadership challenges including succession planning, leadership development, organization scaling and cultural transformation initiatives.
Experience: Chief People Officer, Stripe · Full-time, Jan 2021 - Present · 1 yr 7 mos, Member Board Of Directors, Chair of Compensation Committee, KAR Global, Feb 2020 - Present · 2 yrs 6 mos, Chief Human Resources Officer, Senior Vice President, Autodesk, 2018 - 2021 · 3 yrs, San Francisco Bay Area, I lead all People & Places functions for 10,000+ employees across ~120 offices globally including culture, employee experience, diversity and inclusion, learning and development, talent acquisition, total rewards, employee relations, HR technology and analytics.
